chapter.title: PBX Setup
chapter.para: A soft PBX (such as Asterisk or FreeSWITCH) provides features such as voicemail and call queues. It is perfectly feasible to build an RTC environment without these features. Many of the typical features in a soft PBX have a particular focus on voice communications, rather than other types of RTC such as IM or video.

In a federated environment, it is recommended that a SIP proxy is used to handle all connectivity with external parties, including both incoming and outgoing sessions. The SIP proxy servers have far less features and this inherently makes them easier to configure and secure.
The soft PBX can be configured to register with the SIP proxy or routing entries can be created in both the SIP proxy and soft PBX to send calls back and forth between them as required.

OpenTelecoms maintains a guide to
using repro with Asterisk or FreeSWITCH.
